comment: Professor Lewis made this class very easy. Each week you will have A LOT to read and a good bit of videos to watch also. Since it is an 8 week course there is a lot of material to cram in each week. The assignments are all easy and he gives fair grades. The overall course was very easy to pass and would recommend taking him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Easy quiz and test. He is also super nice and responds to emails quickly. Lots of essay writing and discussion posts but they were fairly simple and just took a lot of time to do and finish. He doesn't grade strictly and also gives you more time if you ask!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: There were a lot of assignments at once because I took the 7-week course, and they were all split into separate parts and documents that made them frustrating to complete. However, the grading is super easy, and all of the material is simple and easy to study. He gives lots of extra credit and is responsive, so I would definitely recommend him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: Amazing professor, responds to emails pretty quick and is very accommodating on extensions with the use of rule 37. I took the 7 week course and there is a lot of reading and videos to watch, but you don't NEED to watch all. Easy grader. Would HIGHLY recommend taking him to get this credit out of the way!!!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: One of the most easiest and caring professor that I gave ever taken in college. I had 3-4 assignments that I needed an extension at the end of the course and he gave me an extension on all of them! Quizzes and tests are so easy, the discussions post do take time to do but super easy to understand!

This class is such an easy A! Only a 6 week course and the work load is not bad at all. All of the discussions are super easy and the tests and quizzes are also easy and are all online with no lockdown or webcam. He also offers so much extra credit but you don't even need it. TAKE HIM!!!!!!!!!!
very easy class, but lots of writing and lots of videos.

This professor was literally sent from heaven. I took his theatre class online but he very attentive and understanding. He had this rule called "rule 37" which means you put that as the subject line in your email and will give you more time if you need it. He was very nice, and the work was easy! It's literally impossible to fail his class.

I took the 7week course so I can't say I know too much about him. He warned that the workload for the 7week course would be a lot, but it wasn't. It may seem like a lot of instructions but it's very easy, especially if you take it online. I had fun and barely referenced the textbook, yet I still got an A.  Be prepared for long discussion posts.

Professor Lewis is how most professors should be - approachable, understanding, and communicative! He's pretty nice, too!

His class isn't a cakewalk per se, but it's hard to fail this class. He is very clear on deadlines and is pretty flexible if you need extensions. Just communicate it to/with him!! I'm an engineering major and enjoyed his class.
He is "The Professor." Best grading and make the class fun to do in short time.

Professor Lewis is my favorite professor yet. I took theatre as a 7-week course required as a gen ed and he truly made it enjoyable. The writings for our two events were very simple, and Professor Lewis did a great job of saying what he wanted. DBAs were very easy as well! LOTS of extra credit as well. Professor Lewis just wants everyone to succeed
Professor Lewis was great and he is super lenient with due dates and giving extra time if needed. I highly recommend taking this class. Just complete the assignments and you will pass.

Great professor! You can tell that he cares for his students. This was a 7 week class, but the work wasn't overwhelming. Weekly assignments, discussion posts, and a few projects. The final project is creating a play from a story in your life with visual elements (i.e. drawings, videos, etc.). Manageable course with a nice professor!

Took this class as an engineering major to check a box but really enjoyed the class. You get two attempts on quizzes which are fairly easy. He gives great feedback,  I really enjoyed his class and Im not a fine arts person.

Online class was great, as long as you do the work youll be good. Participation is a must with weekly discussions. You will need to read plays & watch the videos. Professor gave plenty of chances for extra credit & as long as you do your work & a great job on the final creative project your good. I really dont see how you could not get an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: The class was super fun, being able to watch plays. Instead of a test as a final, we got to write a script as a final, and it was an excellent way to get to know my peers. You can take his quizzes as many times as you need, and you get two tries of the test. He is not a tough grader. You have to keep up with the due dates.

This course was super easy. I took it as a 7 week class yet I never felt rushed or overwhelmed with assignments. Professor Lewis is a very lenient grader and provides a lot of great feedback. The quizzes are a breeze as well (no lockdown browser).
TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. He is the best. He gives great feedback and extra credit work. It's going to be a lot of work. But it is worth it. TRUST ME! The quizzes are so easy.

this was a 7 week course so it went by really quick, which means there is twice the work. BUT it's really not hard because he is a easy grader and the class went by fast. i would recommend if you're a fast learner! Easy A if you need to complete an art
Professor Lewis is the very first lecturer I've ever done one of these for and it's because he's so good! Great class, great content, great professor. Do yourself a favor and take him!

This class was really easy. The professor was also extremely understanding due to the pandemic. He also gave us extra credit. I thought the work load would be a lot because it was a seven week course, but it wasnt bad at all

Dr. Lewis was a pretty understanding professor. He didn't have much contact with the students b/c it was an asynchronous online class; we just had modules to complete every week. 2 fairly heavy discussion board assignments and another one for the final. There was a quiz for every module. You might need some info from the textbook. One test also.

Lots of work especially in the seven week course. Not hard though. Lots of extra credit but you probably wont need it. Emails you back quickly. Record videos for assignments. Super caring during Coronavirus. Have to go to plays unless theres a pandemic.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Prof. Lewis is very caring about his students and their grades. This was a 7 week online class and the workload was heavy, but not impossible. He kept extending due dates, which got confusing, but was very helpful so you can receive full credit for your late turn-ins. Super nice guy and very personable, don't be afraid to reach out for anything!

Professor Lewis is an expert in theatre, and as long as you participate in each class, TPS 1107 should be an easy A. There are three plays you have to see and answer short essay questions after. There is also a quiz online every week over what he posts on D2L or what he wants you to read and what he discusses in class.
Mr. Lewis is a good teacher who loves what he does.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Lewis is so nice and a great guy!! I took him for TPS 1107 hybrid class, the online part is literally a 10 question quiz or a paragraph so it's super easy. 3 required plays with papers to go along, 2 tests, and you spend the last half of the semester creating a play with a group that you perform during finals. It's a really fun class!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: My only complaint for this teacher would be the essays for the mandatory plays. They are pretty specific and it's hard to remember the details needed unless you take notes throughout the play. I would recommend him. Not mandatory until the end of february when you have to start the group final which is a play.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Realy interesting take on theater. Mr. Lewis did a great job keeping the class interesting and getting students to open up.
So funny.

This is the easiest class I have taken at KSU. All his quizzes are online and most of the answers come straight out of the textbook and from his lectures (I took MINIMAL notes and the answers were super simple ones). You have a 5 min play you have to create at the end of the semester, pretty much everyone got A's. Plus, he gives 25 points extra.

Funny, great teacher! I really enjoyed his class! Easy A if you just show up to class and take notes. There are weekly online quizzes that come right from the notes you take and the online tests are easy too. You do have to pay to see 3 plays that you then write a discussion about. Really looked forward to going to his class! Would take again!

Very passionate about the subject. Great lectures about the topics that you are then quizzed over. You have to see three shows which 2/3 were amazing. You have to read three plays, none of which were hard to read. The second half of the semester is a group project which is truly a rewarding experience and you learn to respect people in theatre.

Great guy! The first part of the semester is him going over power points, which he has weekly online quizzes over. The last 3 weeks are mandatory attendance because he makes you write your own play and perform it as your final grade. The majority of this grade is having all of your written work turned in.

Really easy class. All test are online and super easy. He really is passionate about theatre and half the semester all your doing is writing and making a play with group members. although attendance then becomes mandatory. If you just try on the play you'll get an automatic A for final exam. High recommend
My favorite professor my entire semester. Pretty easy grader and the classes are entertaining.  I would definitely recommend both the class and the professor.

Like most people that took this class, theater wasn't really my thing, but Prof. Lewis made the class fun. You can tell that he is very passionate about what he teaches, which makes the class a lot more intriguing. Plus all of his tests and quizzes are online, so just show up to class and take good notes and you'll do fine.

Theatre isn't really my thing, but I took this class to fulfill a gen ed. Professor Lewis is funny and chill, and he totally knows that most people aren't really into theatre stuff. Occasionally his lectures a boring, but the class is really easy. Attendance isn't mandatory for the most part, but you should go anyway.

I really enjoyed this class! easy online quizzes and tests. Class is not mandatory until the final project. you will be expected to get up and act every once in a while. I definitely recommend this professor!

If you do not like acting do not take this class. Professor Lewis is passionate about theater and wants to see it from the students as well. Few tests and they're easy (online), weekly quizzes aren't bad just go to class and pay attention to lecture. Group project mini play at the end. It's a lot of fun if you are into theater and learning about it
He is very passionate about theatre and takes it very seriously. For a class that the university makes you take, you have to out in a lot of work and money going to plays.
He can be annoying, but class is basic. You must go to the plays or you won't pass when the papers happen. I messed up on 1 paper which made me drop from an A to a B

Great professor. You have 3 plays you're required to go to so you have to pay for those. Weekly quizzes aren't that bad I made 100 on most of them. Response papers on the plays also 2-3 pages.  Tests are basically quizzes but longer. Group project in the end that you have to participate in. Attendance is mandatory in the 2nd half.
Great professor! He makes class enjoyable. As long as you pay attention in class, you should pass with an A

Best professor for theatre! However if you absolutely do not like group projects I wouldn't recommend. You do a some acting on the stage and its really fun if you like that sort of thing. You do have to go to a few plays and take tests on them. Tests are online and easy. Make sure you takes notes from the power points.

Best professor for Theatre 1107. 3 Online tests straight from book/lecture. A few short responses to the 3 plays you have to see, beware they are expensive. Attendance isn't taken until final group project. He picks your group and you make up your own 5 minute play. If you put forth effort you will do well. Easy A.
Take this class! Attendance is not taken until final group project.  He gives tests and quizzes online.  You do have to see 3 plays that are like $15

He's super fun! Attendance isn't checked until your final group project begins and then your only allowed to miss 1 class! Don't take the class if you can't afford to spend $80 going to see plays (includes ticket, gas, parking, concessions etc). Easier grader and all tests/quizzes are online.
this guy is obnoxiuos. his presence adgitates me. the only highlight is that i got to kiss a cute boy for romeo and juliet. his class sint hard, just hard to stay awake in.

Easy class, 3 tests total and a few papers responses that are about the plays you have to see. There is a group project at the end where you get 9 people in a group to make a play. As someone who doesn't like group projects it was very easy and enjoyable. TAKE HIS CLASS
Tests are online- guaranteed an A. Only specific classes are  mandatory, other than that he doesn't count attendance. No final, just a final group presentation. Super funny guy.
Fun easy class. Professor Lewis is super nice and really funny. Take this class with a friend so you can take the online quizzes and tests together!

You have a few lectures. Quizzes can be passed without reading. I even passed exams without the book. Just go to most classes so you don't miss the group acting things that count for most of the grade. Don't freak out, they're really simple and easy.

Easy and awesome class. Take the online tests with someone so you can get answers.  Quizzes are unlimited attempts, highest score recorded. 2 blog posts and 1 short essay, easy. 1 performance (5 minutes) on day of final, my group did horrible on it and forgot lines, and got an A+.  You can skip every class except mandatory days and get an A easy.

Tests & quizzes online. You get infinite attempts at the quizzes. Have to go to 3 plays during the semester and write a discussion over it (maybe even a paper). He's a part time actor and is a goofy dude in class. Easy way to fulfill the arts requirement while being entertained and getting an easy A

I enjoyed this class, though I know the topic isn't for everybody. Professor Lewis was very engaging. The quizzes, tests, and in-class, on-stage exercises were all easy. At times, it was fun, and I enjoyed the plays we had to watch. Overall, this class increased my love and knowledge of theater. I recommend it!

The class is very fun. However, his grading on papers is ridiculous. He doesn't give a rubric for papers and expects you to read his mind on what he wants. If that sounds like something you can do take him! You won't be sorry!

Professor Lewis is great! He really knows what he's talking about. He's fun to talk to and makes the class so entertaining! All tests and quizzes are online and fairly simple, and the final is a group performance (not as daunting as it sounds, trust me). Take him, you'll have a great time!

I could barely stand his class. He acts like a know-it-all, and takes forever to grade everything that's why he makes quizzes and tests online (I guess that was a plus), but he grades papers like he's an English professor and knows what he's talking about. Got an A in the class, some parts were fun, but couldn't stand him as a person or professor.
good professor. very entertaining. tests and quizzes are online. a few mandatory performances. a paper. a few blog entries. a group project. very easy a.

Very entertaining teacher, I am not very interested in theater (or at least the kind we learned about) and it wasn't that bad. Lectures are often boring but sometimes we actively participated in class. All tests and quizzes including final and midterm were online. Highly recommend. Need to attend class to know what's on the test.

I really enjoyed this professor. He was extremely entertaining, clear, and easy to follow. Attendance was not mandatory, but you will need to show up in order to do well on the online exams. Take him!
